summary: This document is an email chain from July 2019 between a federal prosecutor and defense attorneys regarding a meeting about the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss scheduling a meeting between the U.S. Attorney's Office and attorneys representing Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney at Cohen & Gresser LLP, involved in scheduling a meeting with the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the SDNY investigation into Epstein and representation of Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Attorney at Cohen & Gresser LLP, copied on emails discussing a meeting with the U.S. Attorney's Office about the SDNY Epstein investigation and representation of Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as 'Ms. Maxwell', she is the client being represented by the defense attorneys in the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The investigation by the Southern District of New York is regarding Jeffrey Epstein, as indicated in the email subject lines.

events.title: Scheduling of Meeting Between SDNY and Maxwell's Attorneys
events.description: Email correspondence to schedule a meeting between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and the defense attorneys representing Ghislaine Maxwell regarding the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Initial Contact Regarding SDNY Epstein Investigation
events.description: Initial emails and a phone conversation between defense attorneys and a federal prosecutor regarding representation of Ghislaine Maxwell in the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: The email chain shows coordination in July 2019 between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and defense attorneys from Cohen & Gresser LLP regarding the Epstein investigation.
The defense attorneys, Christian Everdell and Mark S. Cohen, were representing Ghislaine Maxwell in the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.
The correspondence indicates the SDNY investigation into Epstein was active and involved discussions with Maxwell's legal team.
The emails demonstrate the formal, confidential nature of communications between prosecutors and defense counsel in a high-profile federal investigation.
